body_content.explanation: to invent experiences or events that did not really happen:
examples: He came to believe that these patients were confabulating.
He confabulated a version in which the President praised him for the good work he was doing.
It was just two old friends confabulating.

body_content.explanation: When an artificial intelligence (= a computer system that has some of the qualities that the human brain has, such as the ability to produce language in a way that seems human) confabulates, it produces false information:
examples: The AI tends to confabulate by "making up" details to fill in a story.
When you feed the model its own output, the confabulated text becomes gradually more divergent from human-written text.
